data.title: The History of Painting in Italy Vol. IV by Luigi Antonio Lanzi
data.meta_description: the_history_of_painting_in_italy__vol._iv_by_luigi_antonio_lanzi - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This document provides a summary of the Mantuan School of painting in Lombardy, Italy. It discusses Andrea Mantegna, who established the school in Mantua under the patronage of Marchese Lodovico Gonzaga. The document highlights Mantegna's most famous work from 1495, the Virgin among various saints protecting Francesco Gonzaga. It praises the work for its delicate carnations, glittering armor, varied draperies, and fresh fruits, and notes that each head could serve as a school for its fine character and vivacity inspired by antiquity. The document also discusses Mantegna's perfection of his style influenced by his teacher Squarcione, producing carefully crafted works that
data.text: The History of Painting in Italy Vol. IV by Luigi Antonio Lanzi
